bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Schenectady Business and Professional Women's Club was federated on May 11, 1927 at what is now Schenectady County Community College. Founded on July 15, 1919, the Business and Professional Women's Club was financed through a federal grant established by the War Department to help professional women organizations. According to its vision statement it strives to be "the premier organization of women serving women...an active and inclusive club that fosters economic self-sufficiency, professional mentorship and resources, and a diverse network of members supporting each other, the community and those new to the area." There were 51 charter members, and Ella Magill Talbot served as the first president of the organization. In 1936, the Schenectady Club became incorporated into the New York State, National, and International Federations of Business and Professional Women's Clubs.

Currently the Schenectady Business and Professional Women's Club holds monthly meetings where members, "grow professionally, explore career strategies, and advocate for women regarding important social issues." The Business and Professional Women's Club also helps promote the elimination of gender discrimination in employment and equal pay. Some of the events that the Club hosts include, a fashion show, guest speakers, and a celebration of the woman of the year from their membership. The Club also offers scholarships to women who are high school seniors in Schenectady County and women over twenty-five who are returning to their studies to promote women in their pursuit to receive a higher education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records document the history of the Business and Professional Women's (BPW) Club of Schenectady, NY. The collection includes financial documents, meeting minutes, news clippings, publications, events and programs, scrapbooks detailing the club's activities and accomplishments, and photographs. The collection also includes records retained by club members involved in BPW activities at the district and state levels.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Members Judy Schultz, Jean Osterhout, and Catherine Raycroft donated materials for the collection in a series of four accessions in 2006-2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of audits, budgets, by-laws, expense reports, meeting minutes, anniversary proclamations, and files of the president, secretary, and treasurer. Membership lists, rosters, and directories are also included in the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of materials detailing the events and the educational programs held by the organization. Materials included are bound programs, handbills, leaflets, pamphlets, photographs, and manuals. Various folders hold documents related to the series during a single year or a span of years, while other folders hold specific events or programs held during consecutive years. Some events or programs were held in succession for many years by the organization, such as the Woman of the Year Award, Young Careerist Award, the Annual Fashion Show, the Legislative Platform Program, and the Issues Management Program. A unique fundraising program entitled "Save the Satchel" during 1999-2000 raised money to support the conservation of Susan B. Anthony's alligator satchel. The Business and Professional Women's Club of Schenectady also collaborated with other clubs to hold events such as the 2001 Business and Professional Women's Club of Schenectady and Kiwanis Art Show. Annual conferences and anniversary celebrations are also included in the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Subject Files series contains newspaper clippings, photographs, correspondence, other Business and Professional Women's Club newsletters, publicity scrapbooks and public relations documents, awards and certificates, club dinner invitations from the 1970s, club poems, a 2001 club calendar and membership records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Publications series consists of two publications. One is The Handclasp, a monthly newsletter published by the Business and Professional Women's Club of Schenectady (1932-2011, with gaps),and the other is The Communicator, a monthly newsletter published by the Business and Professional Women's Club of New York State (2001-2003, with gaps).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of scrapbooks created by previous presidents and members of the Business and Professional Women's Club of Schenectady, photographs of members at various events, club highlights, and highlights in the history of the club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of administrative, social, and historical documents of the Business and Professional Women's Club of New York State's District IV between 1936 and 2005. The District IV map is comprised of the following counties of New York State: Fulton, Hamilton, Montgomery, Saratoga, Schenectady, Warren, and Washington. Members of the Business and Professional Women's Club of Schenectady were active in the club at the district level and were elected to upper administration positions. Materials included are bound programs, bulletins, handbills, handbooks, leaflets, pamphlets, photographs, newspaper clippings, and manuals. Documents detailing membership, seminars and programs, meetings, finance, administration, club histories, and meeting minutes are included in the series. Some folders holding conference or convention documents may include memorabilia.
